intro: Urostachys pycnophyllus, commonly known as the dense-leaved mountain grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its compact, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are densely packed, giving it a thick, mat-like appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Urostachys pycnophyllus is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
